definition: Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
plum
surname Li
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to encourage/to cut/to strain

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Li Dazhao said that today is most precious.
sentences.chinese: 同時，李大釗說過，當下是最寶貴的。

sentences.english: Li Dazhao is renowned for his varieties of legal thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗具有豐富的法律思想。

sentences.english: Li da-zhao's thought of mutual-aid evolution can be differentiated two phases.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗的互助進化思想可區分爲前後兩個階段。

sentences.english: Li Dazhao was a pioneer of the Chinese revolution.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗是中國革命的前驅。

sentences.english: Li Dazhao s legal thoughts is closely connected with the legal transformation in modern China.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗的法制思想與中國近代的法制變革息息相關。

sentences.english: Li Dazhao's ideology of library science has a rich connotation.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗圖書館學思想內容涵蓋豐富。

sentences.english: Li Dazhao went through the important phase of the legal system modernization of China.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗的一生經歷了中國法制現代化的主要階段。

sentences.english: In 1920 Li Dazhao met comintern Russian agent G. N. Voitrngsky.
sentences.chinese: 在蘇聯擔任中共駐共產國際代表時的李大釗。

sentences.english: Lidazhao lived in the main room, north on the east wing after his marriage.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗結婚後就住在東廂房北面的正房。

sentences.english: Li Da-zhao is the pioneer of studying French learning thought.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗是五四時期研究法國學術思想的先驅。

sentences.english: Li Dazhao was a pioneer of the Chinese revolution.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗是中國革命的先驅。

sentences.english: Li Dazhao organized and personally directed the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 李大釗組織並親自指揮了這次遊行。

definition: democracy
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
student movement
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)

united front
provisional government
fascism
Huang Xing (1874-1916), revolutionary politician, close collaborator of Sun Yat-sen, prominent in the 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], murdered in Shanghai in 1916
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
a telegram of condolence
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
Zhang Tailei (1898-1927), founding member of Chinese communist party
(China's achievements of) producing an atomic bomb (1964) and hydrogen bomb (1967) and launching a satellite into space (1970)
